topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Deploy the KVM Region Patch 14-15

ul.li: This cumulative WR patch [TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0014.patch] & [TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0015.patch] can be applied on Pre or Post Cloud Deployment.
Pre Cloud Deployment means config_region is not run on the Controller-0 in the KVM region. Post Cloud Deployment means the KVM region is already configured and running.
It is applicable for Denver, Tahoe, Memphis and Sacramento cloud topologies.
It doesn't have any fixes but supports future KVM region upgrade functionality.
It is mandatory and is required for installation of subsequent patches.

bodydiv.note: Do not install patch from Horizon. Install ONLY from CLI. The nodes go to unstable state if patch is installed from Horizon and the nodes have to be recovered during that time. Patch 0014 cannot be removed so execute your patch upgrade strategy with great care. Ensure you have a full backup of the cloud before executing this patch.
You can use the CLI on the active KVM controller: sudo sw-patch query to see if the patch has been deployed properly.

ol.li: You should have installed the following patches during the installation of the KVM Region. If you are installing all the KVM patches for the first time, load all the patches in sequence by following the steps provided below.

section.p: To download the patch you need from the Software Updates and Licensing site, shown above:

ol.li: Select the required patch file (e.g.) from the Downloads list and then click Download.

Un-tar the downladed files (compressed patch files with extension tar.gz and .tar) until the TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0014.patch and TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0015.patch and readme files are available.The Software Licensing site lists and displays patch file names individually for all the three versions of HCG ( HCG_1.1, HCG_2.0 and HCG_2.1) under Software Specification and Download filename. Regardless of their version number, these files are referencing the same files as extracted in the readme.

Check if the MD5 checksum verification file is extracted along with the patch file.
For validating the integrity of the downloaded file, you can run the MD5 checksum verification on the downloaded patch file and verify if the fingerprint of the file matches the version available on the server.

section.title: Install the patch

ol.li:
SSH into active controller in the KVM region.
For example: controller-0 (active controller).
Create a directory for the patch:mkdir -p /tmp/patches

Copy both the patch files to the /tmp/patches directory:
TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0014.patch
TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0015.patch

Execute the following commands to upload both the patches to the database: sudo sw-patch upload /tmp/patches/TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0014.patch sudo sw-patch upload /tmp/patches/TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0015.patch

Execute the following commands to check if both the patches are available for installation:sudo sw-patch query
For example:

Execute the following commands to apply the patch:sudo sw-patch apply TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0014 sudo sw-patch apply TS_HP_15_Custom_PATCH_0015 [The patch state of both the patches will be in "Partial-Apply" state]

Execute the following commands to check the current state of all the hosts:sudo sw-patch query-hostsNow "Patch Current" state of the nodes will be seen as "No" and "Reboot Required" as "Yes". For example:
Execute the following commands to source the openrc file:source /etc/nova/openrc or sudo -i

Execute the following command to patch and reboot the standby controller: system host-patch-reboot <controller-#>
For example if controller-1 is the standby controller and controller-0 is the active controller:system host-patch-reboot controller-1
Wait until the standby controller node comes up after patching and is in Available state. This can be verified using system host-list command.

Execute the following command to switch the active controller from the specified controller: system host-swact controller-#
For example, if the active controller is controller-0:system host-swact controller-0
This command makes controller-1 the active controller and makes controller-0 the standby.
Exit the SSH session.

section.p: Log onto the newly active controller and patch the standby controller.

ol.li:
SSH into the newly active controller.
For example: controller-1.
Execute the following command: source /etc/nova/openrc

Execute the following command to patch and reboot the standby controller: system host-patch-reboot <controller-#>
For example if controller-0 is the standby controller:system host-patch-reboot controller-0
Execute the following command to patch and reboot the compute-0: system host-patch-reboot compute-0
Execute the following command to patch and reboot compute-1: system host-patch-reboot compute-1

Repeat the previous step for each compute node that participates in the cloud.
Use the sudo sw-patch query-hosts command to check if all the nodes are unlocked and the patch 14 & patch 15 are in Applied state.
